text1: A fast escort Frigate, the Storm Runner is fragile but hard hitting. Like all Stardust Ventures ships it is hardened against environmental dangers.

A very fast but fragile corvette, the Ion Skimmer is used either as a fast escort ship or to ferry crew and supplies quickly between systems. While too weak to last long in a real battle, it can hold its own against many of the smaller pirate frigates. Like all Stardust Ventures ships it is hardened against environmental dangers.

A small survey ship with excellent range and speed, the Horizon Chaser is a great addition to any budding exploration fleet. Like all Stardust Ventures ships it is hardened against environmental dangers.

A fast escort Destroyer, the Starlight Guard is designed to take a beating while still being quick enough to keep up with all but the fastest frigates. This speed makes it excellent both as an escort and as a hunter to finish off smaller ships. Like all Stardust Ventures ships it is hardened against environmental dangers.

A frankenstein mash of several ships based around a Starlight Guard core. This is a fast raiding ship favored by certain pirate groups, and excels at chasing down unguarded merchant vessels. The delicate Solar Shielding tech that used to be installed did not survive the pirate mechanics tinkering.

A heavy attack Destroyer, the Storm Seeker is designed to do strong hit-and-run flanking attacks. The spinal mount Large ballistics weapon gives it both high firepower and excellent role customization, although flux cost of the loadout can be a serious limiter compared to larger ships. Like all Stardust Ventures ships it is hardened against environmental dangers.

A varient of the Storm Seeker, this design replaces the spinal Large Ballistic mount with a small fighter bay. Since it sacrifices none of its other capabilities, the Carrier version is still often used for flanking maneuvers. Like all Stardust Ventures ships it is hardened against environmental dangers.
A medium survey ship with excellent range and speed, the Stargazer is the mainstay of many exploration fleets. Like all Stardust Ventures ships it is hardened against environmental dangers.

The basic logistics ship of Stardust Ventures, the Sunbeam Rider carries a good amount of both cargo and fuel and is considerably faster than other freight ships of its class. Like all Stardust Ventures ships it is hardened against environmental dangers.

A long range Exploration Cruiser, the Void Nomad includes built-in salvage gantries to help make the most of any expedition. It is a good bit faster than a Venture, but less robust and is not designed for heavy combat. Like all Stardust Ventures ships it is hardened against environmental dangers.

A swift strike cruiser, the Storm Herald is often used for anti-piracy patrols of major shipping lanes due to its long range and excellent speed. Like all Stardust Ventures ships it is hardened against environmental dangers.

A fast carrier designed to keep up with swift moving exploration fleets, the Cosmic Wind is lighter but faster than a Heron. Like all Stardust Ventures ships it is hardened against environmental dangers.

One of the largest Stardust Ventures designs, this ship is a fast battlecarrier designed to tackle the toughest pirate and drone fleets out on the edges of the sector. Like all Stardust Ventures ships it is hardened against environmental dangers.

Built on the same base frame as the Cosmic Wind, the Vortex Hunter skips the bulky fighter bays for extra speed and maneuverability which makes it excellent for hunting down exposed ships. Like all Stardust Ventures ships it is hardened against environmental dangers.

The welded remains of a Mule, Falcon, and Cosmic Wind, the aptly named Cosmic Horror has become the favorite of many pirate bands for its ability to stand up to direect combat better than most fast carriers. The delicate Solar Shielding tech that used to be installed did not survive the pirate mechanics tinkering.

Swift for a battlecruiser but relatively fragile, the Storm Bringer is designed to take out enemy ships as quickly as possible to avoid getting into a protracted fight. Like all Stardust Ventures ships it is hardened against environmental dangers.
A fast but fragile missile frigate, the Comet Tail gets its name from the single broad engine trail that it leaves. Like all Stardust Ventures ships it is hardened against environmental dangers.

A prototype super heavy fighter, the Plasma Burst ended up being too large to base out of carriers. While incredibly fast, it is fragile and lacks the cargo and fuel to travel far on its own and does best as a fleet support ship. Like all Stardust Ventures ships it is hardened against environmental dangers.

An electronic warfare destroyer, the Warp Diver excels at both system reconnaissance and fleet support. It is a bit more expensive to run than similar hulls, however, and has considerably less firepower available. Like all Stardust Ventures ships it is hardened against environmental dangers.

Fast and armed with a pair of light proton guns the meteorite wing can provide both effective ship strafing as well as enemy missile and fighter interception. The lack of any heavier ordnance does mean they cannot do much more than provide pressure against most war ships, however.

Stardust Venture's take on the light interceptor concept, the Gamma Racer is considerably more survivable than a Talon by including a shield system, although at considerably higher cost. The fighter mounts both Fel and Mist point defense systems, allowing it to be both serviceable against smaller targets as well as somewhat useful against armor and shields.
A tough and well armored fighter armed with a pair of low power Fel weapons and a single Cloudburst missile, the stormwing fighters are designed for battlespace superiority against enemy craft.
Light, quick, and armed with a hard hitting Lithobreaker torpedo, the Moonbreaker is fairly fragile and works best when escorted to its target.
This rare gunship design packs an array of weaponry that rivals even some small frigates. However, it can be easily overwhelmed if it tries to take on too many enemy fighters at once.

The primary long haul logistics ship of Stardust Ventures, the Oort Traveler carries a balanced amount of cargo, fuel, and crew and has considerably longer range than comparable non-tanker logistics ships. Like all Stardust Ventures ships it is hardened against environmental dangers.

The primary long haul logistics ship of Stardust Ventures, the Oort Traveler carries a balanced amount of cargo, fuel, and crew and has considerably longer range than comparable non-tanker logistics ships. Like all Stardust Ventures ships it is hardened against environmental dangers. This variant adds armor and additional combat capability but has increased operational costs and a reduction in cargo and fuel capacity. While able to hold off minor pirate attacks, it is still vulnerable against proper military vessels.

In response to complaints by captains about the difficulties of traversing hyperspace, the Celestial Guide uses an advanced Warp Harmonic Resonator system to greatly improve fleet mobility. A truly unusual looking ship, it was inspired by several species of deep sea creatures on Volturn. Captains are warned that the systems used are quite fragile, and it should be kept from combat situations if at all possible.

A dedicated missile cruiser, the Twilight Defiance has tremendous firepower at its disposal, including four built in Streak MRM launchers. However, it is a fairly fragile vessel and can easily become overwhelmed unless properly escorted. Like all Stardust Ventures ships it is hardened against environmental dangers.

An attempt to reverse-engineer the technology of the Mjolnir cannon, the Proton Gun is considerably weaker and has shorter range but does allow for rapid fire. The highly polarized Proton shells create a mini EMP effect on ships hit with them.

An attempt to reverse-engineer the technology of the Mjolnir cannon, the Proton Gun is considerably weaker and has shorter range but does allow for rapid fire. The highly polarized Proton shells create a mini EMP effect on ships hit with them.

A larger version of the Proton Gun, the Heavy Proton Gun still lacks the power and range of the Mjolnir but the EMP burst from the shells can be an effective ship disabler. While strong against lightly armored targets, it works best when paired with a weapon to strip off armor from more hardened targets.
An autocannon fitted to fire polarized proton shells this weapon offers a high rate of fire and solid performance against most targets.

A flux efficient Free-Electron Laser weapon that fires in short bursts. While fairly low powered, the stream of electrons fired by this weapon can still cause considerable damage as well as having an EMP effect on the target. 
The Free-Electron Laser family of weapons uses a stream of electrons accelerated to near the speed of light to damage the target. Easily modified to match a range of wavelengths, the technology is versitile and comes in several varieties.

A linked pair of flux efficient Free-Electron Laser weapons that fire in short bursts. While fairly low powered, the stream of electrons fired by this weapon can still cause considerable damage as well as having an EMP effect on the target. 
The Free-Electron Laser family of weapons uses a stream of electrons accelerated to near the speed of light to damage the target. Easily modified to match a range of wavelengths, the technology is versitile and comes in several varieties. The linked pair is more flux efficient than the larger Fel Pulsar and has better ammo capacity, but suffers from shorter range and less single shot damage.

A linked set of four of flux efficient Free-Electron Laser weapons. While fairly low powered, the stream of electrons fired by this weapon can still cause considerable damage as well as having an EMP effect on the target. 
The Free-Electron Laser family of weapons uses a stream of electrons accelerated to near the speed of light to damage the target. Easily modified to match a range of wavelengths, the technology is versitile and comes in several varieties. The battery is more flux efficient than the larger Fel Cannon and has better ammo capacity, but suffers from shorter range and less single shot damage.

A larger and more powerful Free-Electron Laser weapon that fires in short bursts. The stream of electrons fired by this weapon can cause considerable damage as well as having an EMP effect on the target. 
The Free-Electron Laser family of weapons uses a stream of electrons accelerated to near the speed of light to damage the target. Easily modified to match a range of wavelengths, the technology is versitile and comes in several varieties.

The largest and most powerful Free-Electron Laser weapon, the cannon does the most damage but at a considerable flux cost. The stream of electrons fired by this weapon can cause considerable damage as well as having an EMP effect on the target. 
The Free-Electron Laser family of weapons uses a stream of electrons accelerated to near the speed of light to damage the target. Easily modified to match a range of wavelengths, the technology is versitile and comes in several varieties.

A short range Free-Electron Laser weapon designed for point defense. While is does somewhat less raw damage than a vulcan, it boasts both longer range and a more versatile damage type. 
The Free-Electron Laser family of weapons uses a stream of electrons accelerated to near the speed of light to damage the target. Easily modified to match a range of wavelengths, the technology is versitile and comes in several varieties.

Fires a 2nd-stage spread of warheads that burst into a cloud of charged energy when in range. Designed for multi-purpose Area of Effect, the Cloudburst missiles can wipe out groups of missiles and fighters. Less effective against ships, but the EMP damage done on impacting enemy hull or armor can cripple a vulnerable vessel.

This version is a rack that holds 3 missiles.

Fires a 2nd-stage spread of warheads that burst into a cloud of charged energy when in range. Designed for multi-purpose Area of Effect, the Cloudburst missiles can wipe out groups of missiles and fighters. Less effective against ships, but the EMP damage done on impacting enemy hull or armor can cripple a vulnerable vessel.

This version is a twin-firing pod that rearms after firing and draws new missiles from an internal stockpile.

Fires a 2nd-stage spread of warheads that burst into a cloud of charged energy when in range. Designed for multi-purpose Area of Effect, the Cloudburst missiles can wipe out groups of missiles and fighters. Less effective against ships, but the EMP damage done on impacting enemy hull or armor can cripple a vulnerable vessel.

This version is a rack that holds 2 missiles.

Fires a 2nd-stage spread of warheads that burst into a cloud of charged energy when in range. Designed for multi-purpose Area of Effect, the Cloudburst missiles can wipe out groups of missiles and fighters. Less effective against ships, but the EMP damage done on impacting enemy hull or armor can cripple a vulnerable vessel.

This version is a rack that holds a single missile and is designed for use on fighters.

Robust launching system that fires Cloudburst missiles, which split into a 2nd-stage spread of warheads that burst into a cloud of charged energy when in range. Designed for multi-purpose Area of Effect, the Cloudburst missiles can wipe out groups of missiles and fighters. Less effective against ships, but the EMP damage done on impacting enemy hull or armor can cripple a vulnerable vessel.

The Stormfront is a twin-firing module that includes a built-in manufactury to allow new cloudburst missiles to be created during the course of the battle.

A rack of advanced guided torpedoes that release a solid metal core at high speeds when close enough to the target. Originally designed to shatter asteroids for easier mining, the technology quickly found use in military applications as the kinetic strike quickly takes down shields.

A rack of advanced guided torpedoes that release a solid metal core at high speeds when close enough to the target. Originally designed to shatter asteroids for easier mining, the technology quickly found use in military applications as the kinetic strike quickly takes down shields.

A rack of advanced guided torpedoes that release a solid metal core at high speeds when close enough to the target. Originally designed to shatter asteroids for easier mining, the technology quickly found use in military applications as the kinetic strike quickly takes down shields.

A rack of advanced guided torpedoes that release a solid metal core at high speeds when close enough to the target. Originally designed to shatter asteroids for easier mining, the technology quickly found use in military applications as the kinetic strike quickly takes down shields.
An economical plasma weapon, the Plasma Caster hits hard but suffers from a fairly slow rate of fire.
An economical plasma weapon, the Heavy Plasma Caster hits very hard but suffers from a fairly slow rate of fire.
An economical plasma weapon, the Plasma Caster hits hard but suffers from a fairly slow rate of fire. The Array version fires a double-shot which can quickly devistate a weakened ship.

An experiment in using plasma for point defense, the Plasma Arc Thrower is generally considered a failure. While it has seen some use as a wide area weapon it is generally considered worse than the Plasma Casters and further R&D on this line was discontinued.

What's more fun than a Thumper? Two Thumpers strapped together! While cheap and highly effective at taking out lightly armored transport vessels, the Walloper is not widely used outside of pirate fleets.

A fairly expensive weapon, Diana's Spear launches large rocket-propelled rounds that seek out their target. While the damage profile is considered by many to be mediocre, its proponents claim that the improved hit rate more than makes up for it. This model has been fitted to fire Fragmentation rounds.

A fairly expensive weapon, Diana's Spear launches large rocket-propelled rounds that seek out their target. While the damage profile is considered by many to be mediocre, its proponents claim that the improved hit rate more than makes up for it. This model has been fitted to fire High Explosive rounds.

A fairly expensive weapon, Diana's Spear launches large rocket-propelled rounds that seek out their target. While the damage profile is considered by many to be mediocre, its proponents claim that the improved hit rate more than makes up for it. This model has been fitted to fire Kinetic rounds.

A fairly expensive weapon, Diana's Arrow launches medium rocket-propelled rounds that seek out their target. While the damage profile is considered by many to be mediocre, its proponents claim that the improved hit rate more than makes up for it. This model has been fitted to fire Fragmentation rounds.

While the damage profile is considered by many to be mediocre, its proponents claim that the improved hit rate more than makes up for it. This model has been fitted to fire High Explosive rounds.

A fairly expensive weapon, Diana's Dart launches small rocket-propelled rounds that seek out their target. While the damage profile is considered by many to be mediocre, its proponents claim that the improved hit rate more than makes up for it. This model has been fitted to fire Fragmentation rounds.

A fairly expensive weapon, Diana's Dart launches small rocket-propelled rounds that seek out their target. While the damage profile is considered by many to be mediocre, its proponents claim that the improved hit rate more than makes up for it. This model has been fitted to fire High Explosive rounds.

A fairly expensive weapon, Diana's Dart launches small rocket-propelled rounds that seek out their target. While the damage profile is considered by many to be mediocre, its proponents claim that the improved hit rate more than makes up for it. This model has been fitted to fire Kinetic rounds.

Experiments in plasma technology resulted in this unusual energy detonation weapon. The plasma payload explodes after a short distance, filling the area around it with a mist of super-charged particles. While not particularly powerful, the blast makes for a very cheap but effective point defense system only hampered by the long delay between shots.

A class of missiles specifically designed to deal with hordes of pirate frigates, the Streak MRMs are fast with excellent guidance systems but suffer from poor damage compared to more standard sector missiles. The Azure class are kinetic shots designed to quickly overload the shields of smaller ships. This is a basic rack of four missiles.

A class of missiles specifically designed to deal with hordes of pirate frigates, the Streak MRMs are fast with excellent guidance systems but suffer from poor damage compared to more standard sector missiles. The Azure class are kinetic shots designed to quickly overload the shields of smaller ships. This is a small rack of only two missiles.

A class of missiles specifically designed to deal with hordes of pirate frigates, the Streak MRMs are fast with excellent guidance systems but suffer from poor damage compared to more standard sector missiles. The Azure class are kinetic shots designed to quickly overload the shields of smaller ships. This is a basic rack of four missiles.

A class of missiles specifically designed to deal with hordes of pirate frigates, the Streak MRMs are fast with excellent guidance systems but suffer from poor damage compared to more standard sector missiles. The Azure class are kinetic shots designed to quickly overload the shields of smaller ships. The mid-sized pod shoots two missiles in rapid succession, and provides enough ammo for six vollys.

A class of missiles specifically designed to deal with hordes of pirate frigates, the Streak MRMs are fast with excellent guidance systems but suffer from poor damage compared to more standard sector missiles. The Azure class are kinetic shots designed to quickly overload the shields of smaller ships. The barrage version shoots four missiles in rapid succession, and provides enough ammo for eight vollys.

The Amber class use fragmentation warheads designed to quickly finished off damaged vessels. This is a basic rack of four missiles.

The Violet class use high-explosive warheads designed to strip the armor of smaller ships. This is a basic rack of four missiles.

A class of missiles specifically designed to deal with hordes of pirate frigates, the Streak MRMs are fast with excellent guidance systems but suffer from poor damage compared to more standard sector missiles. The Crimson class deliver an EMP pulse designed to quickly overload the systems on smaller vessels, as well as deal decent damage to shields. This is a basic rack of four missiles.

The Crimson class deliver an EMP pulse designed to quickly overload the systems on smaller vessels, as well as deal decent damage to shields. This is a small rack of only two missiles.

Activates an advanced missile augmentation system that overloads the warhead and engines of the missiles fired. Must be prepped between activations.
text3: Provides a bonus to missile damage, range, speed, and accelaration
